Page.title: Check NPM version
Page._content:
Enforces "peer" npm dependencies in Meteor packages.

Use this package if you are writing an Meteor package that depends on a given npm package is installed at the app level of projects you are installed in.

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

## Packages
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection-hooks)
* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

## Package
- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/stratosphere)
Page.content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

Managers

  • Mitar
  • Seba Kerchhof
  • Kelly Copley

Repository

  • GitHub repository
Page.more:

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Introduction
Page.description: What else does Meteor Community Packages do?
Page._content: Besides taking care of major community packages we also work and organize other well known projects in the community. Page.title: Testing
Page._content:
## Manager
* [Testing team](https://github.com/orgs/Meteor-Community-Packages/teams/testing)

## Description
Previously knows as `meteortesting`, is now part of Community Packages. These include 3 packages for testing in Meteor with Mocha:

* [Mocha](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-mocha)
* [Meteor Browser Tests](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-browser-tests)
* [Mocha Core](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-mocha-core)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, lets say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use publishComposite to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

Managers

  • Sean Dwyer
  • Jan Dvorak
  • Kelly Copley

Package

  • GitHub repository
  • Packosphere
Page.more:
publishComposite(...) provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, lets say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use publishComposite to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

Managers

  • Sean Dwyer
  • Jan Dvorak
  • Kelly Copley

Package

  • GitHub repository
  • Packosphere

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Page.title: Collection 2

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, lets say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use publishComposite to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

Managers

  • Sean Dwyer
  • Jan Dvorak
  • Kelly Copley

Package

  • GitHub repository
  • Packosphere
Page.more:
publishComposite(...) provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, lets say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use publishComposite to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

Managers

  • Sean Dwyer
  • Jan Dvorak
  • Kelly Copley

Package

  • GitHub repository
  • Packosphere

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Rychl renderovn
Page._content:
Fast Renderer je zpt!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> Toto je pokraovn meteorhacks:fast-render od @arunoda

## Sprvci
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Balek
* [GitHub repozit](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier s PostCSS zpracovnm.

Tento balek umouje pouvat [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) pluginy s .css soubory. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Sprvci
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Tento balek umouje pouvat PostCSS pluginy s .css soubory. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using package.json. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

Sprvci

  • Kelly Copley
  • Mitar

Repozit

  • GitHub repozit

Page.title: Kompozitn publikace
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Sprvci
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvok](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Balek
* [GitHub repozit](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosfra
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Stav uivatele
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Sprvci
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Balek
* [GitHub repozit](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page._content:
## Manager
* [Testing team](https://github.com/orgs/Meteor-Community-Packages/teams/testing)

## Description
Previously knows as `meteortesting`, is now part of Community Packages. These include 3 packages for testing in Meteor with Mocha:

* [Mocha](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-mocha)
* [Meteor Browser Tests](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-browser-tests)
* [Mocha Core](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-mocha-core)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

## Package
- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-postcss)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

## Managers
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Previously knows as meteortesting, is now part of Community Packages. These include 3 packages for testing in Meteor with Mocha:

  • Mocha
  • Meteor Browser Tests
  • Mocha Core

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-postcss)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

## Package
- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-postcss)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

## Package
- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

## Repository
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-postcss)
Page.raw:
---
title: PostCSS
description: PostCSS Plugin For Meteor
lang: en
---

Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

## Repository
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-postcss)

You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers

* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

## Managers
* [Andrew Mao](https://github.com/mizzao)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-user-status)

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

## Packages

* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)

* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: Meteor Package Server Sync
Page._content:

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)

Page.title: Publish composite
Page.description: Reactively publish selection from multiple collections that depend on data from the previous collection.
Page._content:
`publishComposite(...)` provides a flexible way to publish a set of related documents from various collections using a reactive join. This makes it easy to publish a whole tree of documents at once. The published collections are reactive and will update when additions/changes/deletions are made.

This project differs from many other parent/child relationship mappers in its flexibility. The relationship between a parent and its children can be based on almost anything. For example, let's say you have a site that displays news articles. On each article page, you would like to display a list at the end containing a couple of related articles. You could use `publishComposite` to publish the primary article, scan the body for keywords which are then used to search for other articles, and publish these related articles as children. Of course, the keyword extraction and searching are up to you to implement.

## Managers
* [Sean Dwyer](https://github.com/reywood)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-publish-composite)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/reywood/publish-composite)

Page.title: Stratosphere
Page._content:
Stratosphere is a private package server for Meteor. So this is like Atmosphere on your own servers, with private packages.

Besides your own packages, Stratosphere will also give you access to all packages on Atmosphere.

At any time you can switch between package servers by setting an environment variable.

Page.title: User status
Page._content:
Keeps track of user connection data, such as IP addresses, user agents, and client-side activity, and tracks this information in `Meteor.users` as well as some other objects. This allows you to easily see users that are online, for applications such as rendering the users box below showing online users in green and idle users in orange.

Page.title: Collection Hooks
Page._content:
Extends Mongo.Collection with `before`/`after` hooks for `insert`, `update`, `remove`, `find`, and `findOne`.

Works across client, server or a mix. Also works when a client initiates a collection method and the server runs the hook, all while respecting the collection validators (allow/deny).

## Managers
* [Seba Kerchhof](https://github.com/sebakerckhof)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Simon Fridlund](https://github.com/sponsors/zimme)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)

## Packages
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection-hooks)
* [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/matb33/collection-hooks)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/matb33/collection-hooks)

Page.title: Collection 2
Page._content:
A Meteor package that allows you to attach a schema to a Mongo.Collection. Automatically validates against that schema when inserting and updating from client or server code.

This package requires the [simpl-schema NPM package](https://github.com/aldeed/simple-schema-js), which defines the schema syntax and provides the validation logic.

## Managers
* [Eric Dobbertin](https://github.com/sponsors/aldeed)
* [Jan Dvorak](https://github.com/sponsors/StorytellerCZ)
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)
* [Harry Adel](https://github.com/harryadel)

- [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-collection2)
- [Atmosphere](https://atmospherejs.com/aldeed/collection2)

Page.title: Fast Render
Page._content:
Fast Render is back!

Fast Render can improve the initial load time of your app, giving you 2-10 times faster initial page loads. It provides the same effect as Server Side Rendering (SSR), but still sends data over the wire to avoid breaking one of Meteors core principles.

> This is a continuation of meteorhacks:fast-render by @arunoda

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj)

## Package
* [GitHub repository](https://github.com/Meteor-Community-Packages/meteor-fast-render)
* [Packosphere](https://packosphere.com/communitypackages/fast-render)

Page.title: Meteor Package Server Sync
Page._content:

Page.title: PostCSS
Page._content:
Meteor CSS Minifier with PostCSS processing.

This package allows you to use [PostCSS](https://github.com/postcss/postcss) plugins with .css files. You can add your custom plugins by adding Npm packages using `package.json`. You can also use your favourite preprocessor side by side with this package. It allows you to enable many PostCSS plugins, for example Autoprefixer for all preprocessors you use. (Of course you can use it whithout any preprocessor too).

## Managers
* [Kelly Copley](https://github.com/sponsors/copleykj/)
* [Mitar](https://github.com/sponsors/mitar)
